entry.title: SAP Build FAQ: Commercials, Getting Started and More
entry.content:
This FAQ provides an overview of SAP’s commercial offering of SAP Build. It covers the available commercial models for SAP Build and provides answers to questions that we most often hear regarding SAP Build commercial model, onboarding, metering and more. 

What is the SAP Build Unified Offering?  

SAP Build has been designed as the optimal way to extend SAP S/4HANA Cloud and other business applications. Thousands of customers are already experiencing up to 3x faster development speeds with SAP Build according to recent analyst research — and now we’ve made it even better. 

Combined with deep technical integration, SAP Builds unified offering empowers customers to quickly extend and personalize their business solutions using AI-powered application development and automation, while maintaining a clean core and eliminating additional licensing or budgeting complexity. 

What is included in the Unified SAP Build Offering?  

 Customers can access the full range of SAP Build capabilities through just four distinct SKUs.  

  • SAP Build Base User is for end users who need to access applications, gain insights for day-to-day business needs, and approve tasks. 
  • SAP Build Premium User includes all the features of the base user license, with added capabilities for end users to author content, monitor processes, customize pages and deploy attended bots. 
  • SAP Build Developer includes all the features of the Premium User license, plus advanced capabilities for developers and architects who need full access to deployed assets. 
  • SAP Build Runtime Application hosting and lifecycle management services that support the creation and execution for dev/test as well as production environments 

How do I find out what is included in SAP Build?  

  • For a list of services that are included in SAP Build you can visit the SAP Discovery Center, for SAP Build following this link 
  • To find out what is in each SKU, Base, Premium, Developer and Runtime you can visit the SAP Build Pricing Page here. 

What commercial models are SAP Build provided in?  

Consumption Based Model:  

  • SAP BTP Enterprise Agreement (BTPEA) 
  • SAP Cloud Enterprise Agreement (CPEA) 
  • Pay-As-You-Go for SAP BTP 

Subscription Based Commercial Mode:  

  • Service Plan for SAP Build Subscription 

SAP Cloud ERP Private Edition:  

  • SAP Build Entitlements are included in the SAP Cloud ERP Edition 
  • Find more about SAP Cloud ERP Edition here   
  • Find out more about the SAP Build offering in SAP Cloud ERP Private Edition here 

SAP Business Suite Packages: 

  • Entitlements are provided in several of the SAP Business Suite packages 

Partner: 

  • SAP Build offers partners free access to SAP Build and other BTP Services. 
  • SAP Build Test, Demo Development (the site requires you to be logged in as an SAP Partner) 
     

How do I get started with SAP Build?  

SAP Build uses SAP BTPs Cloud Integration Automation (CIA) to quickly get customers and partners up and going on SAP Build.  Find information on how to setup SAP Build here.  For detailed instructions on the activation process, please share this blog post with your technical team 

Does SAP Build include Joule Studio and Joule for Developer?   

Yes, SAP Build provides Joule for Developer and Joule Studio.  Joule Studio is provided with the SAP Build Developer offering.  Joule for Developer features are included, but will need to enable this through the free voucher SKUs.  You can find more information on Joule for Developer here and Joule Studio here. 

Are there specific service plans that are exclusive to the unified SAP Build offering? 

The Joule Studio service is only offered in the SAP Build Developer SKU. Joule for Developer needs to be enabled through the free voucher SKU's and then can only be used with the SAP Build offering, SAP Build Code and Joule for Developer, BTP ABAP Environment.  Visual Cloud Functions in SAP Build Apps is not available in the SAP Build unified SKU. 

Can I migrate from the previous SAP Build SKU’s to the new SAP Build SKU?  
 
Upgrade you SAP Build licenses to access enhanced features and tools.  Use build-specific plans for improved efficiently and customization in your projects.   

For migration of services please refer to this help 

 Can I use both the Old and New Service plans within the same subaccount? 

 The old services cannot be enabled in the same subaccount as the new Build services.  You will need to do a migration per the above migration guide. 

 How does metering work, for example if I use both SAP Build Base User and SAP Build Developer capabilities? 

SAP Build operates on a metering model that relies on specific user roles to determine access and functionality within the platform, which include developer, base user, and premium user. Each user must have a global user ID created by an administrator, who also assigns the appropriate role collection to ensure that the correct authorization is granted. 

This role assignment is critical; for instance, an SAP Build base user shouldn't be able to create new processes within SAP Build, as such permissions could lead to unintended alterations or disruptions in workflows. By understanding and correctly implementing these roles, organizations can effectively manage user capabilities while maintaining the integrity and security of their SAP Build environment. 

For more detailed information on metering and roles visit this help location. 

 How can I learn more about SAP Build?  

  •  SAP Build Basic Trial–Get hands-on experience with a free, 30-day trial, following a step-by-step tutorial on SAP Build. 
  • SAP Discovery Center–Dive deeper with step-by-step guidance and best practices for implementing use cases.  
  • SAP Learning –Develop SAP skills for free, anywhere, anytime, and at your own pace: SAP Build

entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone in Integrated Product Development: A Step-by-Step Setup Guide
entry.content:
Why SAP Build Work Zone for IPD?

In complex IPD environments, teams work with various applications, from CAD systems to PLM tools and collaboration platforms. SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition provides a central access point for all enterprise applications and reduces complexity for end users. The platform enables the creation of role-based, personalized business sites with flexible content structures.

Prerequisites

Before starting the setup, ensure the following prerequisites are met:

  • SAP BTP Subaccount: An active SAP Business Technology Platform subaccount with appropriate permissions
  • Administrator Rights: Subaccount administrator or corresponding roles for configuration
  • SAP Cloud Identity Services: Access to Identity Authentication Services (IAS) for user management

Step-by-Step Setup Guide

1. Start Booster for SAP Build Work Zone

Navigate to the "Boosters" section in your SAP BTP Cockpit and search for "SAP Build Work Zone". The booster automates the basic configuration steps for your subaccount.

2. Select Subaccount

Choose the appropriate subaccount where SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition should be set up.

3. Start your application "SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition"

4. Create and Name Website

5. Link Launchpad_Admin Role with Identity Services

For role management, navigate in the cockpit side panel to:

  • Security → Trust Configuration
  • Click on the tenant you created in SAP Cloud Identity Services

  • A screen opens on the right side - click on the "Attribute Mappings" tab and then "Edit"

  • Under the "Role Collection" column, select the Launchpad_Admin role from the dropdown list

  • Enter "Groups" as attribute and "Admin" as value. Click "+" to add the attributes and save

The mapping is complete. You can now access SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition.

Create a Site

When you create a site, you'll be redirected to the Site Studio Site Settings screen. By enabling "Spaces and Pages – New Experience" view mode, you can create spaces and pages locally in dedicated editors.

  • Click "Edit" in the upper right corner of the Site Settings screen
  • Under "Display" select "Spaces and Pages - New Experience"

  • Go to Site Directory to view the site tile

Your site is empty.

General Process

The general process is structured in the following steps: Apps → Pages → Spaces → Roles → Users

Configure Apps

Click the Content Manager icon in the side panel to open the Content Manager. You'll see a list of content elements added to your subaccount.

  • Go to Content Explorer and select your content
  • Choose the channel for your content

  • Select the channel functionalities and add them to your content

  • After adding functionalities from various applications, add them to your own content

Create Pages

  • Create a page

  • Add a name for the page, description, header, and select relevant widgets

  • Create this for all other necessary applications for IPD

Create Spaces

1. First decide whether one or multiple spaces are necessary

Check your requirements:

  • Do all users have the same access rights?
  • Do you need different security levels?

→ One space with multiple pages is optimal in most cases. Multiple spaces mean exponentially higher administrative complexity.

a) Create one space
Content Manager → Create → Space

  • Add title: e.g., "IPD Workspace", add description
  • Assign pages to space: activate assignment status for all pages
  • Order by priority
  • Save

b) Create multiple spaces
Content Manager → Create → Space:

  • "Collaboration Space"
  • "Specification Management Space"

2. Assign space to Everyone role
Content Manager → Everyone → Edit → Spaces Tab:

  • Activate assignment status for space and save

3. Complete site configuration
Site Directory → Site Settings → Edit:

  • View Mode: "Spaces and Pages - New Experience"
  • Confirm Everyone role

Role Assignments

1. Perform role assignments

a) Use Everyone role when:

  • All users should have access to IPD apps
  • You need a simple, quick solution
  • No differentiated permissions are required

Procedure:

  • Assign apps to Everyone role (activate Assignment Status)
  • Done - no further BTP role assignments needed

b) Create custom IPD role

  • Click Edit in Site Settings

  • In the Assignments area, add your created role ("+" symbol)

Additional Role Information

In addition to the setup steps described above, you can assign predefined roles to users for accessing specific applications within SAP Integrated Product Development. These role templates simplify permission management and ensure that users have access to the right tools and functionalities based on their responsibilities.

For more information, see the official SAP Help documentation: Role Templates for SAP Integrated Product Development .

  • Switch to BTP Cockpit
  • Navigate to Security → Users
  • Select your user
  • Click "Assign Role Collection"
  • Search for your created role and assign it

Conclusion

SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition proves to be a central solution for IPD challenges. The systematic implementation - from booster configuration through structured apps, pages, and spaces to thoughtful role management - creates an efficient work environment.

In the next blog, I will detail the integration of SAP Joule into the Work Zone and show how AI-powered functions can further increase productivity in IPD processes.

entry.title: Error while exporting the local content in Build Work Zone, Standard Edition
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

Recently I have encountered one error when exporting the Local Content in SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition.

This issue is there as of 30th October 2025. In future SAP will do the permanent fix for the issue.

Error Details:

Below will be the error when exporting the Local content in BWZ, SE:

Export process was stopped due to an error. Please try again and if the issue persists, open a support ticket with error code 54c8e678-c55f-4a8e-7def-006b439d6253

PFA the screen shot for same.

Solution: After so many follow up with SAP Product team, they told that if a role id contain Slash "/" in it then it will give this kind of error. they are working  on the solution as permanent fix for same.

 

Meanwhile as a work around we can remove the slash "/" from the role id which is having and it will resolve the issue.

Below is the reply from SAP Team:

"Thank you for your patience while we investigated the export issue you reported, we've identified the root cause and are actively working on a permanent fix.

We found that the export function currently works for all roles that do not have a forward slash (/) in their ID. To unblock your workflow, please recreate your local app (as IDs are immutable) and choose an ID that does not contain a forward slash. This will allow you to export content while we finalize the proper fix.

We are conducting a deeper investigation to implement a robust solution. We will let you know as soon as the fix is deployed."

I have deleted the existing role because once role created we can not change the id. After deletion I have created new role and in id I have not used the slash.

 

I hope this will solve the problem for many customer which took 1 month for me to fix it.

 

Regards,

Rohit Gera

entry.title: How AI is Transforming Your Digital Workspace
entry.content:
How AI is Transforming Your Digital Workspace

Introduction

The modern workplace has changed dramatically. Employees no longer rely solely on static intranets or scattered collaboration tools. Instead, they expect a connected, personalized experience that helps them cut through the noise and focus on meaningful work. Enter artificial intelligence (AI).

AI isn’t just another layer of technology- it’s rapidly becoming the backbone of digital workspaces. By surfacing the right information at the right time, automating repetitive tasks, and enabling smarter collaboration and self-service, AI is redefining how we work, learn, and engage every day.

With digital workspaces in SAP Build, these AI capabilities are already available today—helping organizations deliver intelligent, personalized employee experiences out of the box

The Rise of AI in the Digital Workspace

For years, digital workspaces have been a central hub for business applications, documents, apps, and communications in one place. Useful—but often overwhelming. Employees spent as much time searching for information as they did, acting on it.

Now, AI is filling the gaps. With intelligent copilots, content curation, and contextual answers, digital workspaces like SAP Build Work Zone have evolved from being a destination for information into an engine for productivity and engagement.

Core AI features available today in SAP Build digital workspaces

1. Chatbots & Virtual Assistants
With Joule, SAP’s AI copilot, workspace users can access information instantly. From answering HR questions to surfacing insights from reports, employees can rely on conversational AI to get what they need instantaneously.

Joule, SAP's AI copilot integrated into the digital workspace

2. Task completion with Joule Skills

One can enhance Joule capabilities by creating skills for it in Joule Studio. Connected with SAP systems and third-party applications, Joule can complete tasks like submitting time-off requests, approving workflows, or surfacing KPI dashboards—all from a single interface

  

3. Document Grounding Capabilities
Joule ensures information is both contextual and reliable when using workspace content to ground AI responses. For example, employees can ask “What’s our travel policy in Europe?” and receive an AI response sourced directly from workspace content or SAP SuccessFactors policies when it is enabled as an AI source.

  

4. Content generation and summarization using generative AI
SAP Build leverages generative AI to help users create and refine content—whether drafting announcements, summarizing updates, or suggesting language for a blog post—directly within the workspace.

  

 

 

 

 

Real-Life Examples in Action

  • Information access with grounded responses

Joule responds with answers grounded in the specific workspace content. Employees can query Joule with specific questions like “What is the holiday plan for next year in Germany" or “how can I apply for a sabbatical leave? Point me to the relevant file”.

  • Smart document summaries

Integrated AI services capture the highlights of a workspace document—policy highlights, key insights from data, or high-level overview of a blog.

  • Workflow Automation

From within SAP Build workspace, an employee can ask Joule to “create a purchase order” or “show current pipeline metrics.” The copilot triggers the workflow in connected SAP systems, making productivity seamless.

  • Intelligent content curation

Users can easily create blog posts, feed posts or even knowledge articles in the workspace using the native AI features with simple prompts like “create a workspace feed reminding members to fill their timesheet in a funny and casual tone”.

The Business Impact

  • Faster Information Access: Joule makes information searches 95% faster by surfacing insights and data instantly. Grounded insights reduce time spent searching for answers.
  • Reduced Manual Effort: Generative AI-assisted summarization and content creation free up employee time.
  • Better Governance: AI responses in SAP are backed by enterprise content, ensuring compliance and accuracy.

Preparing for the AI-Powered Workspace

Adopting AI in digital workspaces is not just about flipping a switch—it’s about preparing your organization:

  • Change Management: Train employees to adopt AI workflows and copilots in their daily work.
  • Governance: Define guardrails for AI-generated content, data privacy, and security.
  • Integration: Maximize value by connecting SAP Build with existing SAP and non-SAP applications, making copilots more powerful.

Conclusion

AI is no longer a future trend; it’s already embedded in the digital workspaces employees use today. With embedded AI and Joule, organizations don’t just imagine an intelligent workspace—they experience it

By weaving AI into daily workflows—whether through copilots, recommended learning, or curated content—SAP Build helps organizations unlock productivity, agility, and engagement at scale.

Ready to take the next step?

Learn more about these capabilities and their implementation from the following resources:

  1. Joule integration with Work Zone
  2. SAP Build Work Zone Gets Even More Powerful with AI-Powered Capabilities
  3. Set Up Document Grounding | SAP Help Portal
  4. Integration With Document Grounding | SAP Help Portal
  5. Enabling AI Features | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Access FLP of S/4HANA Rise in SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

 

Writing this blog after long analysis. I hope this will help community to fix the issue.

Requirement: Access the Fiori Launchpad of SAP S/4HANA Rise (Private Cloud) in SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition.

Analysis: In the Build Work Zone, standard edition site we need to add a new Role which should open the FLP of the S/4HANA system which is Private Cloud. SSO should work between Work Zone and Fiori Launchpad of S/4HANA System.

Implementation: Below are the implementation steps in work zone:

1. Add the S/4HANA system in the Cloud Connector with https port

2. Configure the SSO using Principal Propagation so that it wont ask the credentials.

3. Set up the Custom IAS and SSO for Work Zone applicaiton.

4. Create a app, page, space, role in work zone and assing the role to user. PFA the app configuration which will use to connect Fiori Launchpad of S/4HANA system. (App configuration for FLP in Work Zone.jpg)

Error: Once all the configuration in placed, we will access the FLP in the work zone and below error will come. PFA the error screenshot (Error when accessing FLP in Work Zone.jpg😞

Error

App could not be opened either due to an incorrect SAP Fiori launchpad configuration or a missing role assignment.

Solution: After lot of analysis not found any blog for this solution and finally found the solution by uncheck the property in the work zone app "Add intent and default SAP parameters to URL" and save. PFA the screen shot for same ()

After saving, access the FLP again and it open the Fiori Launchpad of S/4HANA On Premise. PFA the working scenario (FLP of S4HANA working in Work Zone.jpg)

Please let me know your feedback if someone is able to fix the issue or having any other issue while configuriing the same.

 

Regards,

Rohit Gera

entry.title: SAP Work Zone vs. Analytics Cloud vs. Fiori Launchpad – Unified Analytics Comparison (Decision Tree)
entry.content:
In today's data driven world, enterprises need an intuitive and efficient digital workspace that unites business processes, analytics, and collaboration. SAP offers several powerful solutions like SAP Work Zone, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), and SAP Fiori Launchpad, while many organizations also extend their ecosystems with non-SAP BI tools such as Microsoft Power BI and Tableau. Selecting the right entry point depends on factors like data architecture, user experience, and the level of integration needed between SAP and non-SAP systems.

With more than 15 years of experience across SAP Analytics and Business Intelligence implementations, I have witnessed how organizations evolve their analytics strategies from siloed reporting to fully integrated decision environments. Through these diverse engagements, it is clear that tools like SAP Work Zone, SAC, Fiori Launchpad, and external BI platforms can coexist to deliver a unified, connected, and scalable analytics landscape. When combined with modern data platforms like Snowflake or SAP Datasphere / SAP Business Data Cloud(BDC), they empower enterprises to turn information into real-time insight.

Let's explore how each of these tools fits within a unified analytics ecosystem and how organizations can determine the right combination to maximize business value.

The Contenders: A Quick Overview

  • SAP Fiori Launchpad: The gateway to SAP applications, offering a role based, personalized user experience.
  • SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC): SAP's flagship analytics platform, combining BI, planning, and predictive capabilities in one solution.
  • SAP Work Zone: A digital workplace that integrates SAP and non-SAP applications, fostering collaboration and productivity.
  • Non-SAP BI Tools (Power BI, Tableau): Industry leading analytics platforms known for flexibility and advanced visualization.

SAP Fiori Launchpad: The Trusted Entry Point

SAP Fiori Launchpad has been a cornerstone of SAP's user experience strategy. It is the go to interface for accessing SAP S/4HANA FICO and other SAP applications.

  • Strengths:
    • Role based access to transactional applications and operational data.
    • Seamless integration with SAP systems.
    • Consistent, intuitive user experience.
  • Limitations:
    • Limited to SAP applications, no native support for non-SAP tools.
    • Lacks advanced analytics and collaboration features.
  • Best For: Organizations that primarily use SAP systems and need a streamlined interface for transactional workflows.

SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC): The All-in-One Analytics Powerhouse

SAP Analytics Cloud is SAP's answer to modern analytics needs. It combines BI, planning, and predictive analytics in a single cloud based platform.

  • Strengths:
    • Unified platform for reporting, dashboards and predictive analytics.
    • Deep integration with SAP source systems like SAP S/4HANA .
    • Built-in collaboration features for team based planning.
  • Limitations:
    • Limited flexibility for non-SAP data sources compared to tools like Power BI or Tableau.
    • Steeper learning curve for non-SAP users.
  • Best For: Organizations heavily invested in SAP systems that want a single platform for analytics and planning.

SAP Work Zone: The Digital Workplace Revolution

SAP Work Zone is a relatively new addition to the SAP ecosystem, designed to create a unified digital workplace. It integrates SAP and non-SAP applications, making it a versatile tool for modern enterprises.

  • Strengths:
    • Unified access to SAP and non-SAP applications.
    • Built-in collaboration tools like chat, news feeds, and document sharing.
    • Customizable workspaces for teams and projects.
  • Limitations:
    • May be overkill for organizations that only need analytics or transactional access.
    • Requires additional configuration for seamless integration with non-SAP tools.
  • Best For: Organizations looking to enhance collaboration and provide a single point of access for SAP and non-SAP tools.

SAP Work Zone, together with the SAP Analytics Cloud Catalog, now carries forward and enhances the capabilities of the earlier SAP Analytics Hub. While Analytics Hub focused primarily on report cataloging, Work Zone extends that vision into a full digital workplace integrating analytics, applications, and collaboration in a single experience.

Non-SAP BI Tools: Power BI and Tableau

While SAP tools excel in their native ecosystem, non-SAP BI tools like Microsoft Power BI and Tableau offer unmatched flexibility and visualization capabilities.

  • Strengths:
    • Superior data visualization and user friendly interfaces.
    • Extensive connectivity to non-SAP data sources like Snowflake, AWS, and Google BigQuery.
    • Strong community support and third party integrations.
  • Limitations:
    • Limited native integration with SAP systems.
    • May require additional middleware for seamless data flow.
  • Best For: Organizations with diverse data sources that prioritize visualization and flexibility over deep SAP integration.

The Hybrid Approach: SAC for SAP, Power BI for Non-SAP

Across several SAP Analytics implementations, a hybrid approach has consistently proven effective for unifying enterprise reporting.
SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) is typically used for SAP source systems, leveraging its deep integration with SAP S/4HANA, along with robust planning capabilities.
Microsoft Power BI complements this by connecting to non-SAP systems such as Snowflake, offering flexibility, advanced visualization and ease of consumption for broader business audiences.

This approach allows us to:

  1. Maintain a single source of truth for SAP data within SAC.
  2. Leverage Power BI's advanced visualization capabilities for non-SAP data.
  3. Use Snowflake as the central data warehouse to integrate data across the organization.

Which Tool Should Be the First Point of Enterprise Access?

The answer depends on your organization's priorities:

  • If SAP integration is key: Start with SAP Fiori Launchpad or SAP Work Zone, depending on whether you need transactional access or a collaborative digital workplace.
  • If analytics is the focus: Use SAP Analytics Cloud for SAP data and Power BI or Tableau for non-SAP data.
  • If collaboration and integration are critical: SAP Work Zone is the clear winner, providing a unified interface for SAP and non-SAP tools.

Visualizing the Decision: A Comparison Chart & Decision Tree

To make this easier, here’s a quick comparison chart:

                                                                               Figure: Decision Tree among the available Tools

Final Thoughts

In today's complex analytics environment, there is no single solution that fits every organization. Success lies in aligning technology choices with business objectives, data strategy, and user needs. The most forward-thinking enterprises design flexible analytics ecosystems, balancing governance, agility, and usability to ensure analytics becomes an enabler, not a barrier.

Based on experience across multiple SAP programs, hybrid architectures often offer the strongest foundation. SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) provides deep integration and governance for SAP data, while platforms like Power BI or Tableau enhance visualization and flexibility for non-SAP data sources. Combined with centralized data hubs like Snowflake or SAP Datasphere or SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC), this model ensures consistency, scalability, and end-to-end insight.

As SAP continues to innovate, solutions such as SAP Work Zone and the SAC Catalog are transforming how users access, share, and collaborate on analytics content. They bridge the gap between SAP and non-SAP systems, creating a truly unified workspace for both business and IT teams.

Ultimately, the goal is not to choose a single tool but to build an integrated analytics ecosystem, one that empowers users at every level to make data driven decisions confidently. Whether an organization adopts a purely SAP centric approach or a hybrid model, the future of analytics lies in seamless connectivity, collaboration and intelligent decision making.
